definitions.definition: The visible vapor/vapour, gases, and fine particles given off by burning or smoldering material.
A cigarette.
definitions.example: Can I bum a smoke off you?;  I need to go buy some smokes.

definitions.definition: Anything to smoke (e.g. cigarettes, marijuana, etc.)
(never plural) An instance of smoking a cigarette, cigar, etc.; the duration of this act.
definitions.example: I'm going out for a smoke.

definitions.definition: A fleeting illusion; something insubstantial, evanescent, unreal, transitory, or without result.
definitions.example: The excitement behind the new candidate proved to be smoke.

definitions.definition: Something used to obscure or conceal; an obscuring condition; see also smoke and mirrors.
A light grey colour/color tinted with blue.

A particulate of solid or liquid particles dispersed into the air on the battlefield to degrade enemy ground or for aerial observation. Smoke has many uses--screening smoke, signaling smoke, smoke curtain, smoke haze, and smoke deception. Thus it is an artificial aerosol.
A fastball.
Of the colour known as smoke.
Made of or with smoke.
To inhale and exhale the smoke from a burning cigarette, cigar, pipe, etc.
To inhale and exhale tobacco smoke.
To give off smoke.
definitions.example: My old truck was still smoking even after the repairs.

definitions.definition: To preserve or prepare (food) for consumption by treating with smoke.
definitions.example: You'll need to smoke the meat for several hours.

definitions.definition: To dry or medicate by smoke.
To fill or scent with smoke; hence, to fill with incense; to perfume.
To make unclear or blurry.
(chiefly as present participle) To perform (e.g. music) energetically or skillfully.
definitions.example: The horn section was really smokin' on that last tune.

definitions.definition: To beat someone at something.
To kill, especially with a gun.
definitions.example: He got smoked by the mob.

definitions.definition: To thrash; to beat.
To smell out; to hunt out; to find out; to detect.
To ridicule to the face; to mock.
To burn; to be kindled; to rage.
To raise a dust or smoke by rapid motion.
To suffer severely; to be punished.
To punish (a person) for a minor offense by excessive physical exercise.
To cover (a key blank) with soot or carbon to aid in seeing the marks made by impressioning.
